folder: Flatbush Avenue & Myrtle Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Flatbush Avenue Extension, east side, north from Myrtle Avenue to Duffield Street. The buildings on the extreme right are on the east side of Gold Street. View 2 shows some slight changes that have taken place, especially the rebuilt gasoline station and the removal of the diner. Close observation will also show that occupancy of some of the buildings have changed. The low building directly across the roof of the diner in view 1 and behind the Sobol Bros. sign in view 2 is the Brooklyn Vocational School Annex.

P. L. Sperr
View 1: October 31, 1927
View 2: October 11, 1940

folder: Myrtle Avenue & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Myrtle Ave., north side, east from Flatbush Ave., Extension.
June 29, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Flatbush Avenue & Myrtle Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Flatbush Ave. Extension, west side, between Myrtle Ave., (left), and Johnson Street (right). Also shown are Nos. 134-144 Duffield Street, west aide, between Myrtle Ave. (left) and Johnson Street (right).  No. 134 is as the right. The tall building at the right background, is the Wilcox Millinery Building.
December 15, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Gold Street & Myrtle Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:
335-341 Gold Street, east side, near the N.E. corner of Myrtle Avenue, showing Dugal G. Campbell's auto showroom. It was formerly the car barn of the Manhattan Bridge street car line.

View 1: October 11, 1940
View 2: Sept. 6, 1939

P. L. Sperr

folder: Flatbush Avenue & Myrtle Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Flatbush Avenue Extension, at Myrtle Avenue, showing the Subway Theatre.
P. L. Sperr
August 22, 1941
